Ann Latsky Nursing College

Ann Latsky Nursing College is a nursing education institution located in Johannesburg, South Africa. The college was established in 1951 and was initially known as the Johannesburg General Hospital Nursing School. It was later renamed the Ann Latsky Nursing College in honor of Ann Latsky, a prominent nursing leader in South Africa who was instrumental in the development of the nursing profession in the country.

The college offers a variety of nursing programs, including a four-year basic nursing program, a one-year post-basic program in community nursing science, and a one-year post-basic program in psychiatric nursing science. The college also offers short courses and continuing education programs for registered nurses.

The mission of Ann Latsky Nursing College is to provide high-quality nursing education and training that is responsive to the changing needs of the healthcare system in South Africa. The college aims to produce competent and compassionate nurses who are able to provide safe and effective care to patients in a variety of settings.

What to Know About the Ann Latsky Nursing College Application Form Portal

The Ann Latsky Nursing College ALNC Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print Acknowledgement Slips, check the admission lists, etc.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the ALNC application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicant is of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to ALNC on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%
Ann Latsky Nursing College APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS
The specific application requirements for Ann Latsky Nursing College may vary depending on the program you are applying to, but here are some general requirements:
  • South African citizenship or permanent residency: Applicants must be citizens or permanent residents of South Africa.
  • Educational qualifications: For the four-year basic nursing program, applicants must have a National Senior Certificate (NSC) or Senior Certificate (SC) with an endorsement for admission to diploma/degree studies or an equivalent qualification. For post-basic programs, applicants must be registered nurses with a diploma in nursing.
  • English language proficiency: All applicants must be proficient in English. Applicants whose first language is not English may need to provide proof of English language proficiency, such as a TOEFL or IELTS score.
  • Health requirements: Applicants must be in good health and provide a medical certificate indicating that they are fit to study and work in a clinical setting.
  • Criminal record check: Applicants may be required to undergo a criminal record check.
  • Application fee: Applicants may be required to pay a non-refundable application fee.

How to Apply | ALNC Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit Application portal: http://www.annatsky.co.za/
  • Choose type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

Ann Latsky Nursing College Application Required Documents

To apply to ALNC you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript
